My dad used to watch or listen to every games Team Korea played in.

But his favorite was Soccer

He would chide them for not doing their best

Social media has given access to critics, or keyboard warriors

Not a player

In some sense he was going home

Foreign coaches bringing out the best

Players playing abroad, learn through better competition

Then they go home

Similar pattern for education at USA and then go home

Koreans played hard

Almost written by K-Drama writers

Listening to the national anthem as expatriate can bring lots of feelings.

Knowing that the balance of days will be lived out in another country.

Watching the players singing together while holding their arms in unison was enough.
